episodeTitle: Excitement Blow-Out! Sanji's Life Under Threat!
description: The Straw Hats reunite with Camie at Mermaid Cove, but Sanji's overwhelming excitement around mermaids causes a near-fatal nosebleed. The Neptune Brothers arrive searching for the crew with a message from Jinbe, but Hammond and the New Fishman Pirates interrupt, revealing the dark history behind Fish-Man Island's blood donation prohibition.

events.title: Sanji Plays with Mermaids at Mermaid Cove
events.description: After two years of separation from women on Momoiro Island, Sanji joyfully plays with mermaids in a pool at Mermaid Cove. His extreme excitement and inability to contain himself foreshadows the dangerous situation to come.
events.significance: Sets up Sanji's near-fatal nosebleed by showing his overwhelming reaction to being surrounded by mermaids after two years of forced abstinence.

events.title: Sanji's Near-Fatal Nosebleed
events.description: Unable to contain his excitement while his head is pressed against the mermaid Ishilly's chest, Sanji erupts in a massive nosebleed that spurts extremely high and takes the shape of a mermaid. Chopper diagnoses this as potentially fatal blood loss, revealing Sanji's rare blood type S RH-.
events.significance: This medical emergency becomes the central crisis of the episode and reveals the deep-seated racial tensions on Fish-Man Island regarding blood donation between species. It also demonstrates how Sanji's two-year isolation on Momoiro Island has made him dangerously susceptible to feminine beauty.

quotes.text: Sanji just lost a dangerous amount of blood!
quotes.speaker: Luffy
quotes.context: Luffy realizes the severity of Sanji's condition after the massive nosebleed

quotes.text: He couldn't handle the excitement after all, and keeping it suppressed caused him to explode like this.
quotes.speaker: Usopp
quotes.context: Usopp explains why Sanji's nosebleed was so severe

events.title: Neptune Brothers Arrive at Mermaid Cove
events.description: Heralded by trumpets, the three princes of Ryugu Kingdom - Fukaboshi, Ryuboshi, and Manboshi - arrive at Mermaid Cove. They are searching for the Straw Hat Pirates to deliver a message from Jinbe. The Straw Hats hide from the royal procession.
events.significance: Introduces the Neptune Brothers, important allies who will play crucial roles throughout the Fish-Man Island Arc. Their arrival with a message from Jinbe hints at important plot developments to come.

quotes.text: I have a question for you.
quotes.speaker: Fukaboshi
quotes.context: Fukaboshi greets the mermaids while searching for the Straw Hats

events.title: Hammond Reveals Blood Donation Prohibition
events.description: Hammond of the New Fishman Pirates emerges and mockingly reveals that no one on Fish-Man Island would give blood to humans. He explains that anyone who donates blood to humans will receive 'judgment in the dark' from those who hate humans, establishing the deep racial divide on the island.
events.significance: This revelation exposes one of the central conflicts of the Fish-Man Island Arc - the systemic discrimination and mutual distrust between humans and fish-men. It sets up the historical backstory of Fisher Tiger and establishes the stakes for Sanji's medical emergency.

quotes.text: No one on this island would give blood to lowly humans.
quotes.speaker: Hammond
quotes.context: Hammond reveals the blood donation prohibition to the Straw Hats

events.title: Fisher Tiger's Death Revealed
events.description: Hammond tells the tragic story of Fisher Tiger, who died from blood loss after a battle because humans refused to donate blood to save his life. This event created the reciprocal prohibition on Fish-Man Island, where blood donation between humans and fish-men is now forbidden.
events.significance: This backstory reveal is crucial to understanding the Fish-Man Island Arc's themes of racism, discrimination, and the cycle of hatred. Fisher Tiger's death at the hands of human prejudice directly led to the current tensions and the rise of extremist groups like the New Fishman Pirates.

quotes.text: Fisher Tiger died bleeding after a battle and could have been easily saved with a transfusion, but no humans were willing to help him.
quotes.speaker: Hammond
quotes.context: Hammond explains the origin of the blood donation prohibition

events.title: Confrontation with Hammond
events.description: After Hammond's revelation about the blood donation prohibition, the Straw Hats engage in a brief confrontation with Hammond and his crew from the New Fishman Pirates. The battle is interrupted when an opportunity for escape presents itself.
events.significance: This skirmish establishes the New Fishman Pirates as antagonists and shows the immediate consequences of the racial tensions on the island. It also demonstrates how the Straw Hats are caught in the middle of Fish-Man Island's internal conflicts.

events.title: Escape on Royal Gondola
events.description: Camie hijacks the royal gondola and tells the Straw Hats they should go into town, as she saw many humans at the port who might be able to donate blood to Sanji. The group boards the gondola and escapes, leaving the Neptune Brothers and others behind at Mermaid Cove.
events.significance: This escape sets up the next phase of the arc, moving the Straw Hats toward Fish-Man District and deeper into the island's conflicts. It also leaves the Neptune Brothers unable to deliver Jinbe's message, creating suspense about what that message contains.

quotes.text: Let's go into town! I saw a lot of humans at the port!
quotes.speaker: Camie
quotes.context: Camie suggests heading to the port to find blood donors for Sanji

events.title: Neptune Brothers Reveal Jinbe's Message
events.description: After the Straw Hats leave, the Neptune Brothers reveal to the mermaids at Mermaid Cove that they were attempting to deliver a message from Jinbe to the Straw Hat Pirates. The contents of the message remain unknown, creating suspense.
events.significance: This revelation establishes that Jinbe has important information for Luffy and foreshadows upcoming plot developments. The fact that the message couldn't be delivered creates dramatic tension and suggests that events may unfold differently than Jinbe intended.

quotes.text: We were attempting to pass on a message from Jinbe to the Straw Hat Pirates.
quotes.speaker: Fukaboshi
quotes.context: Fukaboshi explains their mission after the Straw Hats escape

quotes.text: Sanji just lost a dangerous amount of blood!
quotes.speaker: Luffy

quotes.text: No one on this island would give blood to lowly humans.
quotes.speaker: Hammond

quotes.text: Fisher Tiger died bleeding after a battle and could have been easily saved with a transfusion, but no humans were willing to help him.
quotes.speaker: Hammond
quotes.context: Explaining the origin of the blood donation ban

quotes.text: We were attempting to pass on a message from Jinbe to the Straw Hat Pirates.
quotes.speaker: Fukaboshi
quotes.context: After the Straw Hats escape on the royal gondola

themes.description: The episode explores the deep-seated racial tensions between humans and fish-men through the blood donation prohibition, which stems from humans' refusal to save Fisher Tiger's life.
themes.symbolism: Blood donation serves as a powerful metaphor for the barriers between species and the tragic consequences of prejudice and mistrust.
culturalReferences: Historical segregation and blood donation policies

themes.description: Hammond's revelation about Fisher Tiger shows how one act of discrimination (humans refusing to save Tiger) led to reciprocal discrimination (fish-men refusing to help humans), perpetuating a cycle of hatred.
themes.symbolism: Sanji's life-threatening situation represents how innocent people suffer from historical grievances they had no part in creating.

themes.description: The episode balances comedic elements (Sanji's over-the-top nosebleed) with serious themes (racism, death, and systemic oppression), a hallmark of One Piece's storytelling.
themes.symbolism: The mermaid-shaped blood spurt represents the absurdity of Sanji's character taken to a dangerous extreme.

characterSpotlights.development: Sanji's inability to control his excitement around women, exacerbated by two years on Momoiro Island, creates a life-threatening medical emergency that exposes the racial tensions on Fish-Man Island.
keyActions: Plays with mermaids at Mermaid Cove
Becomes the reason for seeking blood donors

characterSpotlights.development: Fukaboshi is introduced as the eldest of the Neptune Brothers, showing nobility and a desire to deliver Jinbe's important message to the Straw Hats.
keyActions: Arrives at Mermaid Cove with his brothers
Searches for the Straw Hat Pirates
Fails to deliver Jinbe's message due to the Straw Hats' escape
quotes: I have a question for you.

characterSpotlights.development: Hammond establishes himself as a member of the New Fishman Pirates and reveals crucial backstory about Fish-Man Island's racial tensions and Fisher Tiger's death.
keyActions: Tells the story of Fisher Tiger's death
quotes: No one on this island would give blood to lowly humans.

mangaDifferences.difference: The anime extends some scenes at Mermaid Cove and adds additional animation for Sanji's nosebleed sequence that wasn't as detailed in the manga.

trivia.fact: This episode aired on December 18, 2011 in Japan, exactly one week before Christmas, during the height of the Fish-Man Island Arc's popularity.
Sanji's blood type is revealed as S RH-, which is extremely rare. This is a fictional blood type created for the One Piece world.
The Neptune Brothers (Fukaboshi, Ryuboshi, and Manboshi) are all named after types of sharks in Japanese: Fuka (shark), Ryu (dragon/shark species), and Manbo (sunfish/ocean creature).
This episode's TV rating in Japan was 9.5%, ranking it 4th for the week it aired, showing strong viewership during the Fish-Man Island Arc.
